Today I can finally share a passion project I’ve been working on together with @66north and @oceanmissionsiceland ⛵️

Combining science, education, and adventure, Ocean Missions is a non-profit organisation based out of Húsavík, Iceland, dedicated to research and raise awareness of the issues we’re facing with our Oceans. Operating on a 70-year-old wooden sailboat, the team gathers valuable information for both scientists and policy makers and seeks to spread awareness about marine life, plastic polution and the Ocean’s health, with the aim of encouraging others to take action.

I feel lucky and proud to be a part of this amazing group of people that want to learn from each other, inspire and take action when it comes to these issues.  This wouldn’t be possible without the passion-driven people behind the project; Belen, Daniel, Heimir and Charla that have all dedicated their lives to the oceans. 

While sailing around the coast of Iceland we witness the severity of the plastic pollution, which ranges from tiny micro-plastics in the ocean to large, abandoned fishing equipment on our beaches. It's everywhere. The scale of the problem is even larger than I would have imagined.  
The oceans concerns all of us. It’s important to Iceland with whales returning every summer to their main feeding ground. We are just a tiny part of nature. We belong to it, and we need to protect it – not exploit it.   Filmed by the talented: @catkoppel 

#66North #GlacierFriday #OceanMissions @northsailing

The drone we’ve all been waiting for is out: DJI Mavic 3 

I’ve been travelling around the Alps, Dolomites and Iceland lately with this power drone in my backpack, and I can honestly say I’m impressed. Incredible image quality, two lenses, 4k 120fps filming and 46 minutes of flight time. 

The longer flight time has allowed me to reach places I otherwise couldn’t with drones. This one will change the game for what’s possible to capture with drones. 

It has been so fun to be part of this launch and flying the Mavic 3. Well done @djiglobal on building the best drone I’ve ever flown. It will join me on all my adventures from now on. 

 #DJIMavic3 #ImagingAboveEverything

with @xiaomi.global ⛵️ I love sailing and the freedom it gives, so I set sails for a day in Croatia and brought the Xiaomi 11T Pro to capture it. 

The camera in this phone is really amazing and I’m so happy with the outcome of this film. 

It captures the vibe of waking up next to the ocean and spending a day with wind in the sails. 

Shooting in 4k 60fps, the Xiaomi is the perfect tool for shooting on the go and capturing great memories.

Yayy, it’s out! Here’s my recommendations for spending an adventure filled day on this volcanic island with @icelandair ✈️

Only a short flight from Reykjavík, you’ll find Vestmannaeyjar islands. Famous for volcanoes, puffins, ocean adventures and festivals. 

Here’s my list for recommendations:
- Go ATVing with @volcanoatv 
- Do the @ribsafari 
- Hike Heimaklettur
- Grab dinner

Would you like to see more of these Vlog style videos? 😁

#Icelandair

Earlier this summer I traveled to East of Iceland with @icelandair ✈️ This part of Iceland is full of wonders, deep canyons, hot springs and wildlife. 

All those incredible places, are close to the largest town of the East, Egilsstaðir, where @icelandair flies to. 

Here are some of the activities we did, so save this post for your travels to East Iceland. 👇🏼
- Hike up Hengifoss
- Hike Stuðlagil Canyon
- Had organic lunch at @modir_jord 
- The 8km waterfall hike at Laugarfell
- Visit the hot spring at Laugarfell afterwards
- Have coffee in the cute town of Seydisfjordur
- Relax at spa @vokbaths 
- Have incredible sushi at @nordaustur_sushi_bar 
- Explore the fjords 

Have you been to East Iceland? Or would you like to visit those places? 

#Iceland

Music video premiere, to the latest song by @musicbyragnar 🎵 : I’m at home. 

The best thing about travelling, is to get a bit of distance from the nature in Iceland. Because each time we come back, it feels like experiencing it for the first time all over again. 

The video portrays the journey from the airport back to Ragnars home farm in Hali, the cute yellow house that I have good memories from. The drive there is incredible, where you’ll pass waterfalls, glaciers and black sand beaches. I’m Ragnars mind, that drive always gives him the feeling that he’s finally home, so we wanted to capture that. 

I hope you enjoy and make sure to check out Ragnars music on Spotify and on his profile, for some more Icelandic music. 

😍❤️

I’m bringing this amazing place to you 😍 Hopefully you can feel like you’re with us for a moment 💛

#Iceland
